api.title: getactivitystream
api.name: getactivitystream
api.description: Get all the activity of the file/folder

Parameter.description: Specify the path for which you want to get the activity list

Success 200.description: Specify path for which you want to get the activity list
0 - path specified is a folder, 1 - specified path is a file
Action-code says the operation performed on the file/folder
Who performed the operation on that file/folder
Time and date the operation was performed on the file/folder
How was the operation performed eg: Web browser,FileCloud Drive

api.title: showhideactivity
api.name: showhideactivity
api.description: Hide Activity panel

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<commands>
      <command>
          <type> showhideactivity </type>
          <result>{0|1}</result>
          <message>{OPTIONAL ERROR STRING or SUCCESS MESSAGE}</message>
      </command>
</commands>

api.description: The Company may change, add, remove or otherwise modify the API Document offered on this website at any time without prior notice.

api.title: addcommentforitem
api.name: addcommentforitem
api.description: Add a comment to a file/folder

Parameter.description: Specify the full path where you want to add comment
Specify 0 if the path is a folder , 1 if the path is a file
Add the comment you want to add

Success 200.description: Who added the comment to that file/folder
Time and date the comment was added on the file/folder

api.title: getcommentsforitem
api.name: getcommentsforitem
api.description: Gets all the comment of a file/folder

Parameter.description: Specify the full path where you want to add comment

Success 200.description: Who added the comment to that file/folder
Time and date the comment was added on the file/folder

api.title: removecommentforitem
api.name: removecommentforitem
api.description: Remove the comment from the file/folder

      </command>
</commands>

api.title: fileinfo
api.name: fileinfo
api.description: User can fetch information about a file

Success 200.description: whether it can be the root directory or not
whether it can be shareable or not
whether it can be syncable or not
whether the files/ folders can be renamed or not
whether show preview is set or not
whether it can be added in favorites or not

api.title: getaccessdetailsforpath
api.name: getaccessdetailsforpath
api.description: User can delete file/folder in the system (HTTP POST)

api.title: getfilelist
api.name: getfilelist
api.description: User can navigate through the file in system (HTTP POST)

Parameter.description: Path Name to be specified, If the user wants to access MyFiles then use the username as path.
Set it to 1 for ascending sort , -1 for descending sort
You can sort by name, date or size.
Start index of records to retrieve, Note: Index starts from 0. Default 0
Set to any number of record you want to view at once. Default 10

Success 200.description: whether it can be shareable or not
whether it can be downloaded or not
whether it can be the root directory or not
whether it can be syncable or not
whether the files/ folders can be renamed or not
whether show preview is set or not
whether it can be added in favorites or not

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<entries>
      <meta>
          <parentpath>/</parentpath>
          <total>Total no of files and folders</total>
          <realpath>Path of getfilelist</realpath>
          <canupload>1</canupload>
          <isshareable>1</isshareable>
          <candownload>1</candownload>
      </meta>
      <entry>
          <path>Path of file/folder</path>
          <dirpath>/jammy/</dirpath>
          <name>Folder/File name</name>
          <ext/>
          <fullsize>0</fullsize>
          <modified/>
          <type>dir</type>
          <fullfilename>Full file/folder name</fullfilename>
          <size/>
          <modifiedepoch/>
          <isroot>0</isroot>
          <isshareable>1</isshareable>
          <issyncable>0</issyncable>
          <isshared>public</isshared>
          <canrename>1</canrename>
          <showprev>1</showprev>
          <canfavorite>1</canfavorite>
          <canupload>1</canupload>
          <candownload>1</candownload>
          <favoritelistid>0</favoritelistid>
          <favoriteid>0</favoriteid>
          <order>0</order>
      </entry>
<entries>

api.title: search
api.name: search
api.description: User can search for a file/folder

Parameter.description: Specify the directory path in which you want to perform search.
(optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is greater than and equal to the size mentioned.
(optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is lesser than and equal to the size mentioned.
(optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created on and after the date mentioned
(optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created before the date mentioned

Success 200.description: whether it can be shareable or not
whether the files/ folders can be renamed or not
whether show preview is set or not
whether it can be added in favorites or not

api.title: searchext
api.name: searchcontent
api.description:
User can perform context search for a file/folder.
It is mandatory to either specify searchname or searchtext to perform this search.

Parameter.description: (optional) Specify the directory path in which you want to perform search (if not specified user's home directory will be the path)
(optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is greater than and equal to the size mentioned.
(optional)Specify the size in kb, the search will show files that is lesser than and equal to the size mentioned.
(optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created on and after the date mentioned
(optional)Specify the value in date format, the search will show files that was created before the date mentioned

Success 200.description: specifies whether the file is valid or invalid

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<xml>
 <entries>
     <meta>
         <total>1</total>
         <completed>1</completed>
         <highlighting>1</highlighting>
     </meta>
 <entry>
     <path>/tester/Polaris Office.docx</path>
     <dirpath>/tester</dirpath>
     <name>Polaris Office.docx</name>
     <ext>docx</ext>
     <fullfilename>/tester/Polaris Office.docx</fullfilename>
     <modified>Jun 30, 2016 9:06 AM</modified>
     <type>file</type>
     <modifiedepoch>1467295560</modifiedepoch>
     <size>331 KB</size>
     <fullsize>338528</fullsize>
     <validity>VALID</validity>
     <highlight>-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document  
     

      Polaris Office +PDF 
      How to edit and save word, pptx, xlsx, and text files in <hlt>FileCloud</hlt></highlight>
 </entry>
 </entries>
</xml>

api.name: getrmcclients
api.description: Get details of all the RMC clients logged in

Parameter.description: Start index of records to retrieve, Note: Index starts from 0. Default 0
Set to any number of record you want to view at once. Default 10

Success 200.description: The unique identifier for the client device
The api-level is 4 (latest required client api-level is 4)
1|0 - Client device blocked or allowed to login
The last login date and time of client
Number of commands pending to be executed on client

api.title: getrmccommands
api.name: getrmccommands
api.description: Get RMC Commands

api.title: loginguest
api.name: loginguest
api.description: Client login API

Parameter.description: Specify the unique identifier from the client (It can be the device MAC ID or the phone device ID. It just needs to be an unique number that identifies the device).
Set the api-level to 4 (latest required client api-level is 4)

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<commands>
    <command>
        <type> loginguest </type>
        <result>{0|1}</result>
        <message>{OPTIONAL ERROR STRING or SUCCESS MESSAGE}</message>
    </command>
</commands>

api.title: addaclentry
api.name: addaclentry
api.description: Add security permissions

Parameter.description: Set as 'user' | 'group' to assign permissions to a user or a group
If type is 'user' then specify the user email id, for 'group' specify groud id
R - Read, W - Write, D - Delete, S - Share

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<commands>
    <command>
        <type> addaclentry </type>
        <result>{0|1}</result>
        <message>{OPTIONAL ERROR STRING or SUCCESS MESSAGE}</message>
    </command>
</commands>

api.title: getshareforid
api.name: getshareforid
api.description: User can get share details by using shareid

Success 200.description: Set if user sets any view mode
No. of time the file has been downloaded
whether is to allow public access or not
whether is to allow public upload or not
whether is to allow public view only or not
whether is to allow public upload only or not
whether to allow to edit or not
whether to allow to delete or not
whether to allow to sync or not
0 | 1 password protected share disabled or enabled

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<shares>
  <share>
      <shareid>Share Id no.</shareid>
      <sharename>Share Name</sharename>
      <sharelocation>Location of the file</sharelocation>
      <shareurl>Share Url</shareurl>
      <viewmode/>
      <validityperiod>2014-11-07+23:36:00</validityperiod>
      <sharesizelimit>0</sharesizelimit>
      <maxdownloads>0</maxdownloads>
      <downloadcount>0</downloadcount>
      <viewsize>0</viewsize>
      <thumbsize>0</thumbsize>
      <allowpublicaccess>1</allowpublicaccess>
      <allowpublicupload>0</allowpublicupload>
      <allowpublicviewonly>0</allowpublicviewonly>
      <isdir>0</isdir>
      <isvalid>1</isvalid>
      <createddate>06 Nov 2014 02:43:18 PM</createddate>
      <allowedit>1</allowedit>
      <allowdelete>1</allowdelete>
      <allowsync>0</allowsync>
      <allowshare>1</allowshare>
      <shareowner>Share Owner name</shareowner>
      <hidenotifications>1</hidenotifications>
      <ispublicsecure>0</ispublicsecure>   
   </share>
</shares>

api.title: getdiskusagedetails
api.name: GetDiskUsageDetails
api.description: Returns storage usage details

Parameter.description: 0 - gives only details,1 - gives only space usage summary,2 - gives space usage summary + details

Success 200.description: Overall size of all folders and files
Total size of all live folders and files

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
when level = 0|2
   <usage>
     <storageusage>755.53 MB</storageusage>
     <sizelimit>2 GB</sizelimit>
     <usagepercent>37</usagepercent>
     <totalfolders>9</totalfolders>
     <totalfiles>112</totalfiles>
     <totalsize>755.53 MB</totalsize>
     <versionedsize>8.07 MB</versionedsize>
     <versionedfiles>10</versionedfiles>
     <livefiles>101</livefiles>
     <livefolders>8</livefolders>
     <livesize>747.45 MB</livesize>
     <recyclefolders>1</recyclefolders>
     <recyclefiles>1</recyclefiles>
     <recyclesize>9 MB</recyclesize>
   </usage>

api.title: getsystemstatus
api.name: GetSystemStatus
api.description: Will return full detail about the system

Success 200.description: whether it needs plugin update or no
http port supported buy the service, eg:80
whether the profile is online or not
whether the relay is active or not
whether it will save password or not
whether any un-read message are there or not
whether the system has any new invitation
whether it can be remote accessed or not
whether the system is currently remote or no
whether can search other users or no
whether is cloud user status or no
whether to show shared files or no
user status can be set to FULL/GUEST/DISABLED
whether to allow network folder sync or not
whether to disable my files or not
1|0 - context search feature disabled or enabled
specifes the file extension type that is upload restricted
1|0 - uploading or scanning files with ".." disabled or enabled
1|0 - thumbnail image preview enabled or disabled for office documents such as doc,docx,pdf etc.,

api.title: getversions

Success 200.description: Total no. of versions available of a file

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
<versions>
          <total>Total no. of Version available</total>
      <version>
          <versionnumber>Version no.</versionnumber>
          <size>Size of the file</size>
          <how>Agent</how>
          <createdon>2014-Nov-03 09:11:13</createdon>
          <createdby>User name</createdby>
          <filename>file Name</filename>
          <sizeinbytes></sizeinbytes>
          <fileid>File Id no.</fileid>
      </version>
</versions>
